Subject: Installing Cantera on Mac OS X
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=241540864; y=YSyqPkpbn9atLAu6gVRRmfnrRAB4QiW6eU6IFi9LeLzO_lF4tRAk

X-eGroups-Approved-By: dggoodwin <dgoodwin@...> via web; 03 Jul 2006 02:48:05 -0000

Hello all!
I was wondering if someone can help me with some installation
qu=
estions with a Mac OS X (10.3).  I should start by saying that up
until a w=
eek ago, Cantera was on my machine and working fine from
Matlab, however, I=
 wanted to run it through Python and kept getting an
error to the extent of=
 can't find Cantera.oneD or something like
that).  Since I am a novice pyth=
on user, I am not sure if this is
something wrong in the Cantera or in the =
Python, or, most likely, in
the user.  

In a perhaps foolish attempt to fi=
x the problem, I uninstalled Cantera
then I retrieved Cantera off the CVS d=
irectory (after updating my
python and installing sundials), then ran the .=
/preconfig (not sure if
it is a problem that I get the line: checking for m=
atlab... none  when
Matlab is installed on my computer and I have run the m=
ex -setup). 
When I run the make file for this, however, I am getting error=
s to the
extent of:
make[1]: *** [ODE_integrators.o] Error 1
make: *** [ker=
nel] Error 2
(the full text return is reprinted below).  I should mention t=
hat the
sundials flag in the preconfig file is turned to y (I get different=

errors if it is turned to n), I have Sundials 2.2.0, and when I look
for t=
he scripts that it is looking for (i.e. nvector.h), they exist on
my comput=
er in the Cantera directory, but there is only
sundials_fnvector.h in the s=
undials directory.

Can anyone help me make the errors go away?  

Thanks!
=
Jocelyn
